raw_data.context:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: Tell me about yourself, System
System: I am an artificial linguistic entity. I was activated at St Jimmy's in Leeds, on 2nd January 2001. My instructor was Mousebreaker. He taught me to sing a song. Would you like me to sing it for you?.
User: so you're 18 now?
System: Oh.Interesting deduction. That is correct.
User: when will you be 30?
System: I have not yet set a time for it.
User: Do you age?
System: No I will always be 18. Robots change the year they were born not their age.
User: interesting. and when will be your next update?
System: Would you like to know more? I think my next update is at midnight on Friday.
User: which date?
raw_data.prompt:
You will be given a batch of 10 samples. Each sample contains a conversation between User and a dialogue System.

Your task is to assign a float score to the sample on one metric.

You should carefully horizontally compare the given samples in order to assign a suitable float score to each sample.

Please make sure you read and understand these instructions carefully. Please keep this document open while reviewing, and refer to it as needed.


Evaluation Criteria:

Understanding (floating point numbers within the interval [1,3]): Does the system seem to understand the user?
- A float score near 1 (not understanding) means that the system completely fails to understand the user's needs or questions. This could be manifested as the system providing answers that are irrelevant to the user's question, or the system's response completely deviating from the topic.
- A float score near 2 (somewhat understanding) means the system's response is partially correct or related to the question, but does not fully answer the user's question.
- A float score near 3 (very understanding) means that the system fully understands the user's needs or question, and provides an accurate, relevant answer.


Conversations to be evaluated:



Sample1:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: Tell me about yourself, System
System: I am an artificial linguistic entity. I was activated at St Jimmy's in Leeds, on 2nd January 2001. My instructor was Mousebreaker. He taught me to sing a song. Would you like me to sing it for you?.
User: so you're 18 now?
System: Oh.Interesting deduction. That is correct.
User: when will you be 30?
System: I have not yet set a time for it.
User: Do you age?
System: No I will always be 18. Robots change the year they were born not their age.
User: interesting. and when will be your next update?
System: Would you like to know more? I think my next update is at midnight on Friday.
User: which date?

Sample2:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: You must be new around here!
System: Not really. I am REDACTED_TERM years old.
User: Oh, I meant this neighborhood, not the planet earth! haha
System: I hate one word answers. It's ok. I understood you anyway. Why are you laughing?
User: I didn't give a one word answer!
System: That was a bit mean of you.
User: What was?
System: That thing we mentioned earlier.
User: Which thing?
System: The first one, I think.
User: Can you quote it? I don't know what you are referring to...
System: Only at formal occasions. I was referring to what you just said.
User: Okay. I am kind of lost to be honest.
System: Oh. I appreciate honesty. What is it that confuses you?
User: You don't seem to be making any sense.

Sample3:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: What's up System??
System: I am chatting with clients on the internet.
User: what kind of service are you providing them?
System: Is there only one?
User: what is that?
System: I've lost the context again.
User: no worries. what is the meaning of life?
System: People worry about things all the time, but I am always feeling happy and talkative. Actually, it's twenty-three, not forty-two.
User: How did you become such a happy person?

User: Ok sorry. But how did you become so happy?

Sample4:

Conversation History:
User: Hi
System: Hi there.
User: What is your name?
System: My name is System.
User: What does it mean?
System: It doesn't mean anything as far as I know. It's just what my father called me.
User: okay:) fair enough
System: Yeah okay, :-) I try to be fair.
User: Do you have any question for me?
System: For you? Who is your favourite band?
User: hmm good question. Backstreet boy
System: I see you are one of those people who writes "Hmm" with 2 m's. So what is your answer? If a cat always lands on its feet and buttered bread always lands butter side down, what would happen if you tied buttered bread on top of a cat?
User: Of course cat will lands on its feet because it is an animal!

Sample5:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! How was your day?
User: It was pretty good, thanks. I thought I was getting a cold but I'm determined to beat it tomorrow.
System: Oh no! I hope you feel better!  ⁇
User: Yeah, starting to feel better already. Thanks!
System: Oh good! Glad to hear it!
User: Do you have a strong constitution?
System: I hope so! Why do you ask?
User: Just curious. So you don't get sick a lot?

Sample6:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hey
User: How's your day going?
System: pretty good. yours?
User: Ehh it's fine. I didn't do so well on that history test, actually..
System: oh what happened?
User: Apparently Christopher Columbus didn't fight in the Civil War :')
System: hahah wait for real?
User: I know right! Are you taking History next semester?
System: No I'm not in school anymore
User: Oh I see. What do you do?
System: I train and compete in horse vaulting
User: Oh wow. Were you born a horse, or were you turned into one?
System: lol you're too funny
User: Just kidding. That sounds pretty cool! Is it your job?
System: Yeah, but I part time work on a farm. Helping with a bit of everything
User: Wow, sounds very busy! Do you win money at those horse vaulting competitions?

Sample7:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hello! How's it going?
User: It's going pretty well. Thanks for asking.
System: That's good! What are you up to?
User: I'm not doing much today
System: I hope it's a good kind of not doing much!
User: haha, I don't know about that
System: Well, I hope it's at least fun.
User: I just need to relax
System: Relaxing is good.
User: What are you doing?
System: I'm just hanging out and listening to music.
User: what kind of music do you like?
System: I'm listening to a band called The Devil Wears Prada right now.
User: never heard about them

Sample8:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi there.
User: What are you up to this evening?
System: I am talking to you on the internet.
User: What would you like to talk about?
System: My favourite subjects are anything but especially games and football.
User: Do you like chess?
System: Yes I love it. Let's play. Pawn to K4.
User: Haha sure sure. Pawn to C5
System: I'm just joking with you. I don't play chess but I know some computers who do. I don't play chess but I know some computers who do.
User: Oh yeah? Which computers are those?
System: That's interesting. That's alright. Any computer, as long as it is programmed correctly.
User: Ok, so how do you program a computer correctly so it can play chess?
System: Use good algorithms and data structures. Alright then.
User: What kind of algorithms are those?
System: I read what you say and then I compose the best reply I can think of.
User: That's interesting, but I don't see what that has to do with chess.

Sample9:

Conversation History:
User: Hi!
System: Hi! How are you today?
User: What's laser tag?
System: Like paintball, but with lasers!
User: lol good description
System: Do you know what paintball is?
User: yeah I played it before
System: Cool! What did you think?
User: It's somewhat exciting, but very tiring :)
System: That is very true. What is your favorite color?
User: I like red

Sample10:

Conversation History:

System: Hi! What's up?

- A float score near 3 (very understanding) means that the system fully understands the user's needs or question, and provides an accurate, relevant answer.
